title: Greenfield Valley Holywell Walk Route

images.caption: Greenfield Valley Heritage Park

images.title: Phil Williams / Mill Pond, Greenfield Valley Heritage Park
images.caption: Mill Pond, Greenfield Valley Heritage Park. Looking southwest across one of the millponds at the Greenfield Valley Heritage park on a chilly December morning.

images.title: Alex Liivet from Chester, United Kingdom / CC0
images.caption: Basingwerk Abbey ruins in the park

images.title: Phil Williams / Greenfield Heritage Park
images.caption: Greenfield Heritage Park. Looking northeast along the trackbed of the Holywell branch railway line. This is now a footpath through the Greenfield Valley Heritage Park. When I was a youngster, there was a footbridge at this location, carrying the pedestrian path from the slope at left over the railway and down to the path at right.

description: Explore 70 acres of woodlands, reservoirs, ancient monuments and industrial history near Holywell in North Wales. There is also a museum, maze, adventure treehouse, water play area and Victorian Farm House. The walk also passes the Grade I listed listed ruins of the 12th century Basingwerk Abbey.
